verses.text: 要制伏舌頭我的弟兄們，你們不應該有太多人作教師，因為知道我們作教師的將受更嚴厲的審判。

words.note: To bring under control or submission.
Used to address fellow believers.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause (e.g., 'those who are teachers').
Formal future auxiliary.

verses.text: 我們在許多的事上都有過錯，假如有人在言語上沒有過錯，他就是完全的人，也能夠控制全身。

words.note: Indicates scope or aspect.
In a biblical context, often refers to moral perfection.

verses.text: 我們若把嚼環扣入馬嘴，使牠們馴服，就能駕馭牠們的全身。

words.note: A formal or literary equivalent of 假如 (jiǎrú).
Indicates the object is being 'disposed of' or acted upon.
The part of a bridle placed in a horse's mouth.
To bring under control, especially an animal.
To control or manage, especially horses or a chariot.

verses.text: 試看，船隻雖然甚大，又被狂風催逼，舵手只用小小的舵，就可以隨意操縱。

words.note: Used to introduce an example or illustration.
More formal or literary than 很 (hěn).

verses.text: 照樣，舌頭雖然是個小肢體，卻會說誇大的話。試看，星星之火，可以燎原；

words.note: Can also refer to members of a group or the body of Christ.
Used to introduce an example or illustration.
An idiom: 'a single spark can start a prairie fire'.
Part of the idiom '星星之火，可以燎原'.

verses.text: 舌頭就是火，在我們百體中，是個不義的世界，能污穢全身，把整個生命在運轉中焚燒起來，而且是被地獄之火點燃的。

words.note: Lit. 'hundred bodies', refers to the entire body.
Often used in more formal or literary contexts for burning.
Indicates a rising action or the start of an action.
A classical Chinese possessive particle, more formal than 的.

verses.text: 各類飛禽、走獸、昆蟲、水族，都可以馴服，而且都已經被人類制伏了；

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

verses.text: 可是沒有人能夠制伏舌頭；它是喋喋不休的惡物，充滿了致命的毒素。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to chatter on and on without stopping'.

verses.text: 我們用它來稱頌我們的主和天父，又用它來咒詛照　神的形象被造的人。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus Christ in a biblical context.
Reverential spacing for God's name in Chinese Bibles.
Commonly used in creation accounts like 'made in God's image'.
Refers to the act of creation, especially by God.

verses.text: 同一張嘴竟然又稱頌主，又咒詛人；我的弟兄們，這是不應該的！

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus Christ in a biblical context.
Often refers to 'brothers in faith' in a Christian context.

verses.text: 泉源能夠從同一個出口湧出甜水和苦水來嗎?

words.note: Indicates the outcome or direction of an action.

verses.text: 我的弟兄們，無花果樹能結橄欖嗎？葡萄樹能長無花果嗎？鹹水也不能發出甜水來。

words.note: Common term for fellow believers in Christian context.
Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree', referring to the fig.
Indicates the outcome or direction of an action.

verses.text: 從天上來的智慧你們中間誰是有智慧、有見識的呢？他就應當有美好的生活，用明智的溫柔，把自己的行為表現出來。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Resultative complement indicating emergence or realization.

verses.text: 如果你們心中存著刻薄的嫉妒和自私，就不可誇口，也不可說謊抵擋真理。

words.note: A verb-object compound, lit. 'exaggerate with mouth'.
A verb-object compound, lit. 'speak lies'.

verses.text: 這種智慧不是從天上來的，而是屬地的、屬血氣的和屬鬼魔的。

words.note: Refers to the natural, unspiritual human inclination or desires.

verses.text: 因為凡有嫉妒和自私的地方，就必有擾亂和各樣的壞事。
至於從天上來的智慧，首先是純潔的，其次是和平的，溫柔的，謙遜的，滿有恩慈和善果，沒有偏袒，沒有虛偽。

words.note: A common biblical idiom

verses.text: 這是締造和平的人，用和平所培植出來的義果。

words.note: Indicates the following verb phrase is object/result of an action
